Description: Sherd of Clazomenian black-figure paintedpottery amphora; incised lines; design black on red ground with purple accessories; part of a cock to right; joined to another sherd.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: Joined to BM GR 1888,0208.83.a (B115.13), 1888,0208.69 (B 116.1, side A) and a sherd marked 'Captain Bunbury'. It belongs to the same pot as 1888, 0208.70.g + 1888,0208.69 (B 116.1, side B). Findspot number '29' is pencilled and/or scratched on both groups.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B115.14)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 585, 1-2)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 62 § 59, p. 63 § 60, pl. xxix, 4)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 119)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
